service.familyTrustIntroduction: The settlor transfers the ownership of the property to the trustee through a trust arrangement. Based on the agreement of trust law, the legal ownership and beneficial ownership of the property are separated, and the trustee manages and distributes the property according to the interests of the beneficiaries, so as to achieve proper inheritance, asset protection, privacy and security purposes.

optionScene.label: Case Study
optionScene.content: In order to satisfy the needs to manage the respective ESOP plans flexibly,, listed Companies or Pre-IPO Companies in Hong Kong or in the U.S. would often choose to establish ESOP Trust so the trustee can become the custodian of the  equity/stock on behalf of the participants. After certain conditions are met, according to the company's confirmation along with the relevant documents, PS Trust can help arrange the sale of shares and distribute the proceeds to the relevant participants.

optionTarget.label: We serve
optionTarget.content-1: Companies that are going to go public and already setup an overseas structure
optionTarget.content-2: Companies that are already listed in the US or Hong Kong

optionUsage.label: Purpose of ESOP Trust
optionUsage.content-1: Combined with PS Group ESOP management platform, to provide one-stop ESOP solutions
optionUsage.content-2: Professional trust services, providing solutions for ESOP management
optionUsage.content-3: Ensure the security of assets under the ESOP plan

rightIntroduction.label: About Reserved Powers Trust
rightIntroduction.content: As trust jurisdictions, Hong Kong, Singapore and some other countries or regions allow the establishment of reserved power trusts. Compared with discretionary trusts, reserved power trusts can reserve the investment power of trust assets to the settlor without compromising the validity of the trust itself.

usage-1.title: Asset Protection
usage-1.content: Through a legitimate trust structure, the trust assets  can be exempted from creditors' recourse and legal inheritance restrictions, and undistributed trust assets can also be exempted from the beneficiary's creditors' recourse and marital property claims.

usage-2.title: Asset Consolidation
usage-2.content: Based on the circumstances and background of the trust settlor and the beneficiary, we can provide a legitimate structure according to the professional opinions internally and externally. The goal is to put different assets into a single trust and consolidate family wealth into one structure. Upon the passing of the settlor, family members can continue to invest under the same trust.

usage-3.title: Family Inheritance
usage-3.content: Through our expertise in trust arrangements, the collection of ownership and control rights of family businesses can be achieved, avoiding complex inheritance procedures, and also minimize the risk in the process of probate and will disputes.

usage-4.title: Confidentiality
usage-4.content: Under the premise of legal compliance, the assets in the trust (asset type and total amount) can be bounded by privacy protection, and the identities and interests of the relevant parties of the trust are also highly confidential.

insuranceIntroduction.label: About Insurance Trust
insuranceIntroduction.content: The settlor and the trustee sign an insurance trust deed. When an insured event occurs, the insurance company will deliver the claims to the trustee, and the trustee will manage it according to the deed, and distribute the trust assets to the beneficiary according to the settlor's wishes during the trust period.

insuranceUsage.label: Purpose of Insurance Trust
insuranceUsage.content: Combining trust with life insurance products, while enjoying the protection of life insurance products, it also endows trust assets with flexible management, inheritance of intention, privacy and confidentiality and other characteristics.

foreignGrantorIntroduction.label: About Foreign Grantor Trust
foreignGrantorIntroduction.content: The definition of the U.S. tax law needs to meet the two conditions of a non-U.S. trust (Foreign Trust) and a grantor trust (Grantor Trust). If a trust is recognized as a non-U.S trustee trust, income generated from the trust asset is not subject to U.S. tax, and distributions from the trust to beneficiaries can also be exempted from U.S. tax.

foreignGrantorUsage.label: Purpose of Foreign Grantor Trust
foreignGrantorUsage.content: Established by a non-U.S. tax resident as grantor, foreign grantor Trust provides wealth and inheritance planning for U.S. Beneficiaries. Such trusts are set up with the tax advice from a U.S. tax attorney and are structured to help one or more U.S. beneficiaries with U.S. tax liabilities reasonably plan for future issues to reasonably minimize their potential U.S. gift and inheritance tax.

charitableIntroduction.label: About Charitable Trust
charitableIntroduction.content: Individuals and families can realize their charitable wishes by establishing a Charitable Trust and applying for tax incentives.

usage-1.title: Achieve tax optimization
usage-1.content: Charitable Trust can apply for tax benefits.

usage-2.title: Achieve Charitable Wishes
usage-2.content: A well-run family Charitable Trust can allow family members and future generations to participate in the management of family philanthropy, enable posterity to understand family culture and values through participation in family philanthropy, provide ways for family governance, and cultivate a sense of responsibility for family members and future generations.

familyOfficeIntroduction.content: To cater with clients’ sophisticated needs, we will coordinate and collaborate with  professionals including investment consultants, lawyers and tax consultants. tailored a full range of uniquely designed family services for clients, assist clients in building equity structures of the Family Office, and optimize the governance and wealth planning of clients' families.

familyOfficeUsage.label: Purpose of Family Office
familyOfficeUsage.content: Assist clients in designing and building Family Office, provide a full range of comprehensive family services, optimize client family governance, strengthen risk management and wealth management, establish family cultural heritage, and achieve family harmony.
